column4: NautilNautilus turned into a zombie process, and I can't kill it, even with kill -9. I don't want to restart my computer because I can't start Nautilus. Help.
zombie processes don't hurt anybody, just leave it
yes, but now I have no desktop
and i can't browse my files
You should still be able to Alt+F2 and type "nautilus"
which is what people normally do with computers
I did, and it won't start
Why can't you reboot?
when I run it from the terminal, it just sits there
Because I'm not going to lose my uptime over a dumb file browser
and i'm stubborn
Well just log out and log on.
I restarted GDM and X multiple times
Do you have any remote mounts like SSH or SMB open?
They're always what hangs it for me.
I don't use nautilus for remote stuff. That's what scp is for.
Yeah, but have you done something like 'mount -t smbfs' or an sshfs mount?
no
Well, I'm just about as clueless as you then.
sorry
yeah this sucks. I'll fool around with it some more and let you know if I find a solution
